snippet: Scientists are not just studying the bay on Long Island, but working to restore its waters and tidal flats to health.
abstract: Editorial praises work being done to restore Shinnecok Bay in Long Island by Shinnecock Bay Restoration Program, run by Stony Brook University's School of Marine and Atmospheric Sciences and its Institute for Ocean Conservation Science; notes that by seeding bay with clams, program's scientists hope to fix damage wrought by pollution, overfishing and global warming.
lead_paragraph: Scientists are not just studying the bay on Long Island, but working to restore its waters and tidal flats to health.

headline.seo: Clams and Grass to the Rescue of Shinnecock Bay
headline.main: Clams and Grass to the Rescue
headline.print_headline: Clams and Grass to the Rescue

keywords.value: State University of New York at Stony Brook
